titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ira Cohen Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

note.p: This finding aid, which is compliant with the Yale EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0., has a MARC record in Yale's ILS with the following bib number: 11730914.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday February 14, 2018 at 19:13

did.unittitle: Ira Cohen papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.physdesc: (203 boxes) + 14 broadside, 2 record album storage, and 1 art
did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, photographs, artwork, objects, audiovisual materials, and electronic media the document the life and work of Ira Cohen. The papers include materials relating to other writers, artists, and groups including Ronnie Burk, Louise Landes-Levi, the Living Theatre, Gerard Malanga, Petra Vogt, Tom Weigel, various Beat generation writers, and others. Artwork includes mail art, paintings, drawings, screen prints, and posters. Objects include stamps, Cohen's typewriter, masks, and plaster and papier mache casts. Casts include life masks made by Cohen of friends including Allen Ginsberg and Julian Beck and a cast of William S. Burroughs' hand.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Johan Kugelberg on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Boxes 44, 93-97, 185-213 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 98, 214-219 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Ownership Copyright
userestrict.p: The Ira Cohen Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Ira Cohen Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Notes
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Ira Cohen
bioghist.p: Ira Cohen (1935-2011) was an American poet, photographer, publisher, and filmmaker. He was associated with the Living Theatre, as well as various writers associated with the Beat generation.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Papers
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, writings, notebooks, photographs, artwork, objects, audiovisual materials, and electronic media the document the life and work of Ira Cohen. The papers include materials relating to other writers, artists, and groups including Ronnie Burk, Louise Landes-Levi, the Living Theatre, Gerard Malanga, Petra Vogt, Tom Weigel, various Beat generation writers, and others. Artwork includes mail art, paintings, drawings, screen prints, and posters. Objects include stamps, Cohen's typewriter, masks, and plaster and papier mache casts. Casts include life masks made by Cohen of friends including Allen Ginsberg and Julian Beck and a cast of William S. Burroughs' hand.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eleven series: I. Selected Papers, 1924, 1960s-2000s. II. Correspondence, 1970s-2000s. III. Papers Relating to Other Writers and Groups, 1960s-2000s. IV. Manuscript Materials and Working Files, circa 1961-2007. V. Notebooks, 1979-2005. VI. Photographs, 1960s-2000s. VII. Papers Removed from Printed Material, undated. VIII. Artwork, 1970s-2000s. IX. Objects, circa 1936, 1980s-2000s. X. Audiovisual Materials, 1965-2000s. XI. Electronic Media, 1980s-2000s.

did.unittitle: Selected papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials were selected by Johan Kugelberg for use in a master class taught at the Beinecke Library in 2011.

Yarra.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of foreign travels (including Turkey, Zurich, and Naples), arts and cultural events (including readings, plays, and concerts), arrangements of objects, and friends and family. Includes Ira Cohen, Brad, Lois, Robert Whelan, Marina, Lakshmi (also includes photographs by Lakshmi), Sprachsalz, Jose Oliver, Robt W., R. and Cynthia, Michael R., Ferdinando and Judith, Ondi, Raphael, Bob Horito and Lauren, 3 doormen, Allan G., Michelle W., Jason W., Robert and Tia, Eric LaPrade, Swami and Herbert, "The Three Sages," Billy, pictures with note from Robert W. Yarra, Bobby Y., Michael and Jena, Alice F., Mariana Rydwal, the Tibet House, Lawrence W. celebration, Adam, Louise and D., Bhajan. Also includes notes or poems by Ira, one about September 11th, and postcards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Ira Cohen and other subjects by (or from): Peter Cunningham, Indra Tamang, Marcia Resnick, Ira Landgarten, Francesco Masci, Joe Geitler, Hisashi, Jan and Lois Alsop, Bruce Carpenter, Charlz (Charles) Junod, Maurizio Rugger (Ruggeri), Isabel, Karen Hershey, David Sands, Misao, Larry Sawyer, Susan Falk, E., Asako, Marco Bakker, Mia Hanson, Ellen Pearlman, Christopher Stein, Gary Halpern, Matthew Lewis, John Beigelow Taylor, Gail Parker, P. Segura, Emily (with note), Karin (with note), Hibbard (with note), Wird Oudejans (with note), I. (with note), John Taylor, Vali Myers, A. Parker, Hawk, Hallie, Filipa, Billy, Eric LaPrade, J.N. and Ann Reilly, H. Thalmann, Francesca.

Labels include: Elegea for Allen, Don Snyder, Gregory and his daughter - nurse Sheri, Anita Fiset, For Trawdi Duck, Shiv Mirabito, Gregory's funeral, Chili, Tambri, Jack Barker, Ira giving readings, Pour Ira Cohen, Alhambra 1929, Jade Hirschmann reading poetry at his book party, For Jon, love Bing, Gerard Malanga (stationary on which note is written), Ram Nath, Hannelore Rezzomico (note regarding her), P.S. 1 Contemporary Art Center, Charles Henri Ford, John - Michelle - Teny - Wilson, Ed Nielson (poem), St. Valentines Day '05 - Hotel Chelsea, Sumita - my little "adopted" Nepali girl, Didi with baby doing Puja, Ignite Magazine release party, Rolend Valery, Raphael Aladdin Cohen.

Places include London, Brussels, New York, Crete, Erlangen. Also includes photographs by Ira Cohen, photographs of family and friends, objects, and events with music and costumes. Also includes some documents, artwork, cards, ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ira, The CD is just the audio of the video. The video is PAL system (European) so you will have to have it transferred to NTSC (US) to play it at home. The start of it is a bit messy as I was trying to adjust something in the camera at the time. It cuts and then it's a pretty smooth ride from there. Enjoy yourself watching and listening to yourself! Love, Benjamin

did.unittitle: Mama London Corinna MacNeice

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dear Ira, Forgive the delay - Reid (Argos' bro) made his exit a couple of weeks ago after a seven-month battle w/ melanoma. He was buried in a sheet on the land... still contemplative here - death is a mysterious affair!... Anyway, I send you your [?] 'Mama London': should you think worth 'netting' or whatever I can make SVHS copy (better quality). Much Love Ira, Corinna

did.unittitle: Ira Cohen poet; Dharmaware Woodstock NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from White Buffalo Multi-Media dated 1999-09-14:

Dear Ira, We enjoyed your presence at Dharmaware as well as the opportunity to hear your poetry and see that amazing film - wow, what a rarity. Someone recently mentioned you'd like a copy of the video we shot that night, so here you go - unedited - no tripod, just a documentation we thought would fit in the Woodstock Museum archives. If you need any of it in any format, the original was done on DV format, so it's gigital and ready to go anywhere. Looking forward to your poetry again. Peace Brother, [?]

accessrestrict.p: Boxes 98, 214-219: Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
